mods.abstract: Letter written on April 8, 1967 from South Vietnam, mostly asking for news of family and friends and supplies such as film. Sales speaks of receiving the new M-16 rifle which replaced the M-14 infantrymen previously used.

John L. Sales of Nashville, Tenn. (b. April 7, 1947) served in the United States Marine Corps from May 1966 to May 1968. A member of Co. A, 1st Battalion, 4th Rgt., 3rd Marine Division, he saw action in the northern sector of South Vietnam from December 1966 to June 1967. Wounded twice in combat, Pvt. Sales received the Purple Heart medal.
